title: [Large-scale] Programming-Based Social Data Analysis Course for Enhancing Computational Thinking (CT)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social studies knowledge and understanding of basic programming syntax
context.additional_context: Practical Training Focused on Applying Programming to Social Science Data Analysis for Working Professionals

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to define and decompose problems using social domain datasets.

Learners can identify three or more data patterns (trends, periodicity, outliers) in given datasets (e.g., CSV/JSON) using Python, design at least one algorithm (e.g., moving averages, filtering), implement code, and visualize results (graphs/tables).
Strengthen the competency to model social phenomena through abstraction and interpret simulation results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
